newsitem.title: USA: La. Land ups interest in Wyoming units.
newsitem.headline: La. Land ups interest in Wyoming units.

text.p: The Louisana Land and Exploration Co said on Thursday that it had entered into two separate purchase and sale agreements to acquire additional working interests in natural gas reserves in the Madden structure in Wyoming.

The agreements, with BHP Petroleum Inc and Coastal Oil and Gas Corp, will increase LL&E's working interest in the deep Madison Formation in the Madden unit to 45 percent from 34 percent, the company said in a statement.
LL&E's working interest in deep Madison Formation in the neighboring Long Butte unit will increase to 27 percent from 4 percent, the company added.
The Madden structure encompasses 80,000 acres within the Long Butte and Madden units.
"We are moving forward aggressively in the development of both the deep and shallow horizons in this world class gas reserve," said LL&E president H. Leighton Steward.
Terms of the agreements were not disclosed.
